name: fortinet-fortiproxy
label: Fortinet FortiProxy
description: FortiProxy provides a secure web gateway, which protects against web attacks with URL filtering, visibility and control of encrypted web traffic through SSL and SSH inspection, and application of granular web application policies. This connector facilitates automated operation related to firwall policy, firewall address, firewall address group, firewall service group, and banned users.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.description: Specify the URL of the FortiProxy server to connect and perform automated operations.
fields.name: server_url

fields.title: API Key
fields.description: Specify the API key configured for your account for using the FortiProxy APIs.
fields.name: api_key

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.
fields.name: verify_ssl

operations.title: Create Firewall Policy
operations.description: Creates a firewall policy in the FortiProxy server based on Policy Name, Schedule Name, Source Interface, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Policy Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the firewall policy that you want to create in the FortiProxy server.
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the firewall policy that you want to create in the FortiProxy server. Note: Maximum length should be 35.

parameters.title: Schedule Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the schedule associated with the firewall policy you want to create in the FortiProxy server.
parameters.name: schedule
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the schedule associated with the firewall policy you want to create in the FortiProxy server. Note: Maximum length should be 35.

parameters.title: Policy Type
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the type of firewall policy that you want to create in the FortiProxy server. You can choose from the available options such as Explicit Web, Transparent, SSH, WanOpt, etc.
parameters.name: type
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Select the type of firewall policy that you want to create in the FortiProxy server. You can choose from the available options such as Explicit Web, Transparent, SSH, WanOpt, etc.

Explicit Web.title: Explicit Web Proxy
Explicit Web.description: Specify the explicit web proxy of the firewall policy that you want to create in the FortiProxy server.
Explicit Web.name: explicit-web-proxy
Explicit Web.tooltip: Specify the explicit web proxy of the firewall policy that you want to create in the FortiProxy server. Note: Maximum length should be 35.

Explicit Web.title: Destination Interface
Explicit Web.description: Specify the outgoing (egress) interface of the firewall policy that you want to create in the FortiProxy server.
Explicit Web.name: dstintf
Explicit Web.tooltip: Specify the outgoing (egress) interface of the firewall policy that you want to create in the FortiProxy server. Note: Maximum length should be 79.

Explicit Web.title: Transparent
Explicit Web.description: (Optional) Select enable if you want the web proxy to use the original client address; else select disable.
Explicit Web.name: transparent
Explicit Web.tooltip: (Optional) Select enable if you want the web proxy to use the original client address; else select disable.

Transparent.title: Source Interface
Transparent.description: Specify the incoming (ingress) interface of the firewall policy that you want to create in the FortiProxy server.
Transparent.name: srcintf
Transparent.tooltip: Specify the incoming (ingress) interface of the firewall policy that you want to create in the FortiProxy server. Note: Maximum length should be 79.

Transparent.title: Destination Interface
Transparent.description: Specify the outgoing (egress) interface of the firewall policy that you want to create in the FortiProxy server.
Transparent.name: dstintf
Transparent.tooltip: Specify the outgoing (egress) interface of the firewall policy that you want to create in the FortiProxy server. Note: Maximum length should be 79.

Transparent.title: Force Proxy
Transparent.description: (Optional) Specify the setting that you want to apply for the 'Force Proxy' parameter in the firewall policy that you want to create in the FortiProxy server. You can choose between enable or disable. If you select enable, then all TCP transparent traffic is forced through the proxy; if you select disable, then the TCP transparent traffic is not forced through the proxy.
Transparent.name: force-proxy
Transparent.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the setting that you want to apply for the 'Force Proxy' parameter in the firewall policy that you want to create in the FortiProxy server. You can choose between enable or disable. If you select enable, then all TCP transparent traffic is forced through the proxy; if you select disable, then the TCP transparent traffic is not forced through the proxy.

parameters.title: VDOM
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied. If this parameter is not provided, then the management VDOM is used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error is returned. The URL parameter must be one of the following: vdom=root (Single VDOM), vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs), or vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.title: Action
parameters.name: action
parameters.description: (Optional) If supported, the clone action can be specified. clone clones the specific resource, and when clone is set the "New Resource ID" parameter must be provided. Note: If this parameter is provided when it is not supported, the action will be ignored and an invalid request error will be returned.
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) If supported, the clone action can be specified. clone clones the specific resource, and when clone is set the "New Resource ID" parameter must be provided. Note: If this parameter is provided when it is not supported, the action will be ignored and an invalid request error will be returned.

parameters.title: New Resource ID
parameters.name: nkey
parameters.description:
(Optional) If the "Action" parameter value is specified as "clone", then specify the ID for the new resource to be created. For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, specify the "Action" parameter as "clone" and "New Resource ID" parameter as "address1_clone".
Note: This parameter can only be used when the "Action" parameter is set to "clone".
parameters.tooltip:
(Optional) If the "Action" parameter value is specified as "clone", then specify the ID for the new resource to be created. For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, specify the "Action" parameter as "clone" and "New Resource ID" parameter as "address1_clone".
Note: This parameter can only be used when the "Action" parameter is set to "clone".

parameters.description: (Optional) Select the type of address group you want to create in the FortiProxy server. You can choose from the following options: Default or Folder
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Select the type of address group you want to create in the FortiProxy server. You can choose from the following options: Default or Folder

parameters.title: Comment
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the comment that you want to associate with the firewall address group you want to create in the FortiProxy server.
parameters.name: comment
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the comment that you want to associate with the firewall address group you want to create in the FortiProxy server. Note: Maximum length should be 255.

parameters.title: Exclude Address
parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: (Optional) Select enable if you want to enable address exclusion or disable to disable address exclusion.
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Select enable if you want to enable address exclusion or disable to disable address exclusion.

enable.title: Exclude Member
enable.name: exclude-member
enable.description: (Optional) Specify the address exclusion member that you want to assign to the firewall address group you want to create in the FortiProxy server.
enable.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the address exclusion member that you want to assign to the firewall address group you want to create in the FortiProxy server. Note: Maximum length should be 79.

parameters.title: Color
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the color of the icon on the GUI that you want to assign to the firewall address group you want to create in the FortiProxy server.
parameters.name: color
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the color of the icon on the GUI that you want to assign to the firewall address group you want to create in the FortiProxy server. Note: Maximum length should be between 0 to 32

parameters.title: Allow Routing
parameters.name: allow-routing
parameters.description: (Optional) Select enable if you want to enable the use of this group in the static route configuration or disable to disable the use of this group in the static route configuration.
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Select enable if you want to enable the use of this group in the static route configuration or disable to disable the use of this group in the static route configuration.

parameters.title: Security Fabric Object
parameters.name: fabric-object
parameters.description: (Optional) Select enable if you want to set the security fabric of the object as global or disable to set the security fabric of the object as local.
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Select enable if you want to set the security fabric of the object as global or disable to set the security fabric of the object as local.

parameters.title: VDOM
parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied. If this parameter is not provided, then the management VDOM is used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error is returned. The URL parameter must be one of the following: vdom=root (Single VDOM), vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs), or vdom=* (All VDOMs)
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied. If this parameter is not provided, then the management VDOM is used. parameters.title: Action
parameters.name: action
parameters.description: (Optional) If supported, the clone action can be specified. clone clones the specific resource, and when clone is set the "New Resource ID" parameter must be provided. Note: If this parameter is provided when it is not supported, the action will be ignored and an invalid request error will be returned.
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) If supported, the clone action can be specified. clone clones the specific resource, and when clone is set the "New Resource ID" parameter must be provided. Note: If this parameter is provided when it is not supported, the action will be ignored and an invalid request error will be returned.

parameters.title: New Resource ID
parameters.name: nkey
parameters.description: (Optional) If the "Action" parameter value is specified as "clone", then specify the ID for the new resource to be created. For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, specify the "Action" parameter as "clone" and "New Resource ID" parameter as "address1_clone". Note: This parameter can only be used when the "Action" parameter is set to "clone".

operations.title: Get Authenticated Firewall Users List
operations.description: Retrieves all authenticated firewall users or specific authenticated firewall users of the authgrp access group from the FortiProxy server based on the start index, count, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Start
parameters.description: Specify the starting entry index from which you want this operation to fetch the list of authenticated firewall users from the FortiProxy server.
parameters.name: start
parameters.tooltip: Specify the starting entry index from which you want this operation to fetch the list of authenticated firewall users from the FortiProxy server.

parameters.title: Count
parameters.description: Specify the maximum count of records that you want this operation to fetch from the FortiProxy server.
parameters.name: count
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum count of records that you want this operation to fetch from the FortiProxy server.

parameters.title: Include IPV4 Users
parameters.description: Select this option (default is selected) to include IPv4 users.
parameters.name: ipv4
parameters.tooltip: Select this option (default is selected) to include IPv4 users.

parameters.title: Include IPV6 Users
parameters.description: Select this option to include IPv6 users.
parameters.name: ipv6
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to include IPv6 users.

operations.title: DeAuthenticate Firewall Users
operations.description: Deauthenticates firewall users from the authgrp access group in the FortiProxy server based on the user type, user ID, IP address, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: User Type
parameters.description: Specify the type of users you want to de-authenticate from the authgrp access group in the FortiProxy server.
parameters.name: user_type
parameters.tooltip: Specify the type of users you want to de-authenticate from the authgrp access group in the FortiProxy server.

parameters.title: User ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of users you want to de-authenticate from the authgrp access group in the FortiProxy server.
parameters.name: id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of users you want to de-authenticate from the authgrp access group in the FortiProxy server.

parameters.title: IP Address
parameters.description: Specify the IP address of the users you want to de-authenticate from the authgrp access group in the FortiProxy server.
parameters.name: ip
parameters.tooltip: Specify the IP address of the users you want to de-authenticate from the authgrp access group in the FortiProxy server.

parameters.title: IP Version
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the IP version [ip4|ip6] of the users, you want to de-authenticate from the authgrp access group in the FortiProxy server. Note: This parameter is required only if the User Type is 'firewall'.
parameters.name: ip_version
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the IP version [ip4|ip6] of the users, you want to de-authenticate from the authgrp access group in the FortiProxy server. Note: This parameter is required only if the User Type is 'firewall'.

parameters.title: Authentication Method
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the authentication method [fsso|rsso|ntlm|firewall|wsso|fsso_citrix|sso_guest] you want to de-authenticate from the authgrp access group in the FortiProxy server. Note: This parameter is required only if the User Type is 'firewall'.
parameters.name: method
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the authentication method [fsso|rsso|ntlm|firewall|wsso|fsso_citrix|sso_guest] you want to de-authenticate from the authgrp access group in the FortiProxy server. Note: This parameter is required only if the User Type is 'firewall'.

parameters.title: DeAuthenticate All Users
parameters.description: (Optional) Select this option if you want to de-authenticate all users from the authgrp access group in the FortiProxy server. Note: If this parameter is selected, then all other parameters will be ignored.
parameters.name: all
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Select this option if you want to de-authenticate all users from the authgrp access group in the FortiProxy server. Note: If this parameter is selected, then all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.title: Users
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify an array of user objects to de-authenticate from the authgrp access group in the FortiProxy server. Use this parameter to de- authenticate multiple users at the same time. Each object should include the above properties.
parameters.name: users
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify an array of user objects to de-authenticate from the authgrp access group in the FortiProxy server. Use this parameter to de- authenticate multiple users at the same time. Each object should include the above properties.

operations.title: Add Users to Banned List
operations.description: Adds users to the banned list of the authgrp access group in the FortiProxy server based on the IP addresses and the ban expiration time you have specified.

parameters.title: IP Addresses
parameters.description: Specify a comma-separated list of IP addresses that you want to add to the authgrp access group in the FortiProxy server. IPv4 and IPv6 addresses are supported.
parameters.name: ip_addresses
parameters.tooltip: Specify a comma-separated list of IP addresses that you want to add to the authgrp access group in the FortiProxy server. IPv4 and IPv6 addresses are supported.

parameters.title: Expiry
parameters.description: Specify the time in seconds until the expiration of the ban. If you want the ban to be indefinite, then enter '0'.
parameters.name: expiry
parameters.tooltip: Specify the time in seconds until the expiration of the ban. If you want the ban to be indefinite, then enter '0'.

operations.title: Get All Banned Users List
operations.description: Retrieves list of all banned users of the authgrp access group from the FortiProxy server.

operations.title: Clear All Banned Users List
operations.description: Clears the list of all banned users of the authgrp access group from the FortiProxy server.

operations.title: Clear Banned Users List by IP
operations.description: Clears the list of all banned users of the authgrp access group from the FortiProxy server based on the IP addresses that you have specified.

parameters.title: IP Addresses
parameters.description: Specify the list of banned IP addresses that you want to remove from the authgrp access group in the FortiProxy server. IPv4 and IPv6 addresses are supported.
parameters.name: ip_addresses
parameters.tooltip: Specify the list of banned IP addresses that you want to remove from the authgrp access group in the FortiProxy server. IPv4 and IPv6 addresses are supported.
